item.title: Report X-2023090875
item.description:
Report X-2023090875

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-18T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-15
  • City: ANAHEIM
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was found to be wet on the outer container while been loaded to the van. Package was place in a hazmat bag and tote and taken for inspection. Upon inspection we found one of the two bottles had a loose cap causing it to leak approx 5oz on to the outer container. All clean up material was kept with package. DescribePack: the cap in one of the two bottles was loose causing a small leak. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was place in hazmat bag and tote.

Upon inspection we found all four bottles had been damage causing them to leak out. DescribePack: Bottles had been cracked causing them to leak. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was place in a hazmat bag and tote.

item.title: Report X-2023090672
item.description:
Report X-2023090672

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-11
  • City: CARSON
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found by QA during the preload sort and declared damaged. put inside hazmat liner and red tote to stop spilling. MSDS report obtained by shipper. SCMS was processed. Then taken to the hazmat processing cage and put inside a yellow bin. Total duration 1 hour. DescribePack: The bottles of reagent alcohol had loose caps and spilled DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was immediately taken and put inside a red lined hazmat tote and processed accordingly by qualified QA personnel.

THE BOX WAS PLACED UPSIDE DOWN IN THE TOTE TO PREVENT FURTHER SPILL.

  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one of the metal 5 gallon can of DR-100 (un1993) had been damaged by a sharp object and that 5 gallons had been released. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release. so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report E-2023100438
item.description:
Report E-2023100438

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-16T18:14:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-28
  • City: SACRAMENTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Terminal Located at 3516 Kiessig Ave Sacramento, CA 95823, USA for a 1-gallon release of “Suma Cal-X” UN2031 from a damaged 1-gallon plastic jug on the trailer floor. Patriot Environmental responded and observed the release of 2- gallons of “Suma Cal-X” UN2031 from two damaged 1-gallon plastic jugs. The release Impacted an area on the trailer floor of 4’X 4'. No soil or drains were impacted. Patriot Environmental Recovered the “Suma Cal-X” UN2031 with absorbents and neutralizers. Patriot Environmental overpacked the damaged 55-gallon DM. Patriot Environmental reported that they created one 85-gallon DF and one 55-gallon overpack drum of waste. Patriot Environmental left the waste on site with XPO

item.title: Report E-2023100335
item.description:
Report E-2023100335

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-14T00:31:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-22
  • City: BLYTHE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UBY experienced a UN3267 Super Strip Plus release 4 boxes each containing (4) 1-gallon poly pails. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 0.5-gallons of product released to the cardboard packaging only. The boxes were crushed as a result of a load shift, causing the material to release from the jug lids. The damaged jugs were collected and containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023100303
item.description:
Report E-2023100303

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-14T00:31:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-12
  • City: AZUSA
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A Veolia driver initially picked up the drum in question on 9/5/2023 from the offeror and the trailer was used to pick up other materials on 9/12/23. The driver noticed that there was some liquid on the front of the trailer along with oily stains on the back of the trailer. Veolia personnel started to remove the drums from the trailer and identified the leaking drum which was located at the nose of the trailer. The leaking drum was a 55 gal metal drum with a pin hole leak that appeared to occur from potentially rubbing/impact against another drum during transportation which was a weak spot due to corrosion. The driver made multiple stops that day and he has stated that he did not notice any staining on the back-end of the trailer when he loaded addition drums at each stop. Also he did not notice any oily material near or around the front of the trailer during those stops. We are unsure of the duration of the spill but based on the quantity still left in the drum, roughly 5 gallons had leaked out. The drum was placed into a salvage drum and the spill clean up was completed by the Veolia in-house crew. Most of the material was contained inside the trailer with minimal amounts outside of the trailer. There was no evidence of a any spill on the ground itself.

item.title: Report X-2023070325
item.description:
Report X-2023070325

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-17T00:34:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-12
  • City: BARSTOW
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: GATX 89137 was identified by Barstow Mechanical with a vapor release only. The cause of the release was identified as a deteriorated gasket. BNSF HM Responders secured the release by replacing the gasket and tightening the man way swing bolts. Estimated amount released is approximate for vapor.

item.title: Report X-2023070324
item.description:
Report X-2023070324

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-14T00:31:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-10
  • City: Calwa
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Man way swing bolts identified as loose-4 total and a deteriorated man way gasket was also identified during the inspection securement that would not allow compression once secured. The man way gasket was replaced and swing bolts secured with the car being spotted to an accessible track for exterior decon.
